rules.rule_text_en: Use I'll / I will for a decision made now (at the moment of speaking). Use won’t for a quick refusal or decision not to do something.
rules.rule_text_uk: Використовуй I'll / I will для рішення, яке приймаєш зараз, у момент мовлення. Won’t — для швидкої відмови або рішення щось не робити.
rules.rule_short_en: I'll = decision now; won't = refusal/decision not to.
rules.rule_short_uk: I'll = рішення зараз; won't = відмова/рішення не робити.
examples: The phone is ringing. I’ll answer it.
I forgot my wallet. I’ll pay you back tomorrow.
I won’t tell anyone. It’s a secret.

rules.rule_text_en: We often use I'll to offer help, agree, or promise. Use won’t to show refusal. Use Will you …? to ask someone to do something.
rules.rule_text_uk: Ми часто вживаємо I'll, щоб запропонувати допомогу, погодитися або пообіцяти. Won’t показує відмову. Will you …? — прохання до співрозмовника.
rules.rule_short_en: I'll = offer/agree/promise; Will you…? = request.
rules.rule_short_uk: I'll = пропозиція/згода/обіцянка; Will you…? = прохання.
examples: That box looks heavy. I’ll carry it.
Okay, I’ll email you tonight.
Will you close the window, please?

rules.rule_text_en: Don’t use will for future plans that are already arranged or decided. Use present continuous, present simple, or going to for arrangements.
rules.rule_text_uk: Не вживай will для планів, які вже домовлені або вирішені. Для домовленостей використовуй present continuous, present simple або going to.
rules.rule_short_en: No will for fixed plans; use present/going to.
rules.rule_short_uk: Для домовлених планів не will; використовуй present/going to.
examples: I’m meeting Sam at 6. (not I’ll meet)
We’re going to visit my parents this weekend.
The train leaves at 7.15.

rules.rule_text_en: Use shall mostly in questions with I/we: Shall I …? / Shall we …? to offer, ask for advice, or suggest an idea.
rules.rule_text_uk: Shall зазвичай уживають у питаннях з I/we: Shall I …? / Shall we …? — щоб запропонувати, попросити поради або запропонувати ідею.
rules.rule_short_en: Shall I/we…? = offer/suggestion/advice.
rules.rule_short_uk: Shall I/we…? = пропозиція/порада/ідея.
examples: Shall I open the window?
Shall we go by taxi?
What shall we do next?

rules.rule_text_en: Use will to predict the future or say what you believe will happen. Don’t use will for plans already arranged or decided.
rules.rule_text_uk: Will вживають для прогнозів і того, що, на твою думку, станеться. Не використовуй will для планів, які вже домовлені або вирішені.
rules.rule_short_en: Will = prediction, not a fixed plan.
rules.rule_short_uk: Will = прогноз, не домовлений план.
examples: I think it’ll snow tonight.
You’ll love that film.
She’s meeting the client tomorrow. (planned)

rules.rule_text_en: We often use will with words like probably, I think, I’m sure, I don’t think. After hope, we usually use the present (I hope it rains / doesn’t rain).
rules.rule_text_uk: Will часто вживають із probably, I think, I’m sure, I don’t think. Після hope зазвичай уживаємо теперішній час (I hope it rains / doesn’t rain).
rules.rule_short_en: Will + probably/I think… ; after hope → present.
rules.rule_short_uk: Will + probably/I think… ; після hope → present.
examples: I’ll probably be home late.
I don’t think they’ll agree.
I hope you feel better soon.

rules.rule_text_en: We normally use will for the future, but we can also use will to talk about now when we make a guess about the present (She’ll be busy).
rules.rule_text_uk: Зазвичай will — про майбутнє, але інколи will уживають і про теперішнє, коли робимо припущення (She’ll be busy).
rules.rule_short_en: Will can mean a guess about now.
rules.rule_short_uk: Will може означати припущення про тепер.
examples: Don’t call him; he’ll be asleep now.
They’ll be in a meeting at the moment.
She’ll know the answer.

rules.rule_text_en: Shall is used mainly with I/we (often formal): I shall / we shall. The negative is shan’t or shall not. In everyday speech, we usually say I’ll / we’ll.
rules.rule_text_uk: Shall вживають головно з I/we (часто офіційно): I shall / we shall. Заперечення — shan’t або shall not. У повсякденній мові частіше кажуть I’ll / we’ll.
rules.rule_short_en: Shall is mainly I/we; shan’t = negative.
rules.rule_short_uk: Shall переважно з I/we; shan’t = заперечення.
examples: We shall contact you soon.
I shan’t be long.
We’ll see you tomorrow.

rules.rule_text_en: For future actions: use will when you decide at the moment; use (be) going to when the decision was made earlier.
rules.rule_text_uk: Для майбутніх дій: will — коли рішення приймаєш у момент мовлення; (be) going to — коли рішення було прийняте раніше.
rules.rule_short_en: Will = decision now; going to = plan already decided.
rules.rule_short_uk: Will = рішення зараз; going to = план уже вирішений.
examples: I’m tired. I’ll go to bed early.
I’m going to buy a new laptop next week.
Thanks. I’ll call you back in a minute.

rules.rule_text_en: For predictions, both will and going to are possible. Use going to when there is evidence now; use will for general expectations or opinions.
rules.rule_text_uk: Для прогнозів можливі і will, і going to. Going to — коли є ознаки зараз; will — для загальних очікувань або думок.
rules.rule_short_en: Going to = evidence; will = opinion/expectation.
rules.rule_short_uk: Going to = ознаки; will = думка/очікування.
examples: Look at those clouds. It’s going to rain.
I think the team will win.
The car is making a strange noise. It’s going to stop.

rules.rule_text_en: Use will be doing for an action in progress at a future time. Use will have done for an action completed before a future time.
rules.rule_text_uk: Will be doing — дія буде тривати в певний момент у майбутньому. Will have done — дія завершиться до певного моменту в майбутньому.
rules.rule_short_en: Will be doing = in progress; will have done = finished by then.
rules.rule_short_uk: Will be doing = у процесі; will have done = завершено до того часу.
examples: At 9 tomorrow I’ll be flying to Rome.
By 9 tomorrow I’ll have arrived in Rome.
This time next week we’ll be travelling.

rules.rule_text_en: Will be doing (future continuous) = you will be in the middle of doing something. Compare: I’ll be eating (in progress) vs I’ll eat (simple).
rules.rule_text_uk: Will be doing (future continuous) = ти будеш у процесі дії. Порівняй: I’ll be eating (у процесі) vs I’ll eat (простий факт/рішення).
rules.rule_short_en: Future continuous = in the middle of an action.
rules.rule_short_uk: Future continuous = у середині дії.
examples: Don’t call at 8; I’ll be driving.
At noon we’ll be having lunch.
She’ll be working late tonight.

rules.rule_text_en: We also use will be -ing to describe a future activity (often as a natural/expected situation), sometimes sounding more polite than will do.
rules.rule_text_uk: Will be -ing також уживають, щоб описати майбутню діяльність як «нормальну»/очікувану; інколи це звучить ввічливіше, ніж will do.
rules.rule_short_en: Will be -ing can describe expected future activity.
rules.rule_short_uk: Will be -ing описує очікувану майбутню діяльність.
examples: I’ll be seeing Alex later, so I can ask him.
Will you be using your car this evening?
The manager will be meeting the team tomorrow.

rules.rule_text_en: Will have done (future perfect) means something will be complete before a time in the future. Often used with by + time.
rules.rule_text_uk: Will have done (future perfect) означає, що щось буде завершено до певного моменту в майбутньому. Часто з by + time.
rules.rule_short_en: Future perfect = completed by a future time.
rules.rule_short_uk: Future perfect = завершено до майбутнього моменту.
examples: By Friday, we’ll have finished the report.
She’ll have left by the time you arrive.
In two years they’ll have been married for ten years.

rules.rule_text_en: After when, before, after, as soon as, until, while etc. we use the present (not will) to talk about the future: when I arrive, before you go.
rules.rule_text_uk: Після when, before, after, as soon as, until, while тощо для майбутнього вживаємо теперішній час (не will): when I arrive, before you go.
rules.rule_short_en: After time words, use present for the future.
rules.rule_short_uk: Після слів часу — present для майбутнього.
examples: I’ll text you when I get home.
Please lock the door before you leave.
Wait here until I come back.

rules.rule_text_en: We can use the present perfect after when/after/as soon as/until to show one action finishes before another: when I’ve finished, I’ll call. Don’t use it if actions happen together.
rules.rule_text_uk: Можна вживати present perfect після when/after/as soon as/until, щоб показати, що одна дія завершиться раніше: when I’ve finished, I’ll call. Не вживай, якщо дії відбуваються одночасно.
rules.rule_short_en: Present perfect shows 'finished before' after time words.
rules.rule_short_uk: Present perfect показує «завершиться раніше» після слів часу.
examples: When I’ve saved enough, I’ll buy a car.
As soon as you’ve sent it, let me know.
When I arrive, I’ll call you. (together → present simple)

rules.rule_text_en: After if, we use the present for the future (If it rains, we’ll stay in). Use if for something possible; use when for something expected/sure.
rules.rule_text_uk: Після if для майбутнього вживаємо present (If it rains, we’ll stay in). If — для можливого; when — для очікуваного/певного.
rules.rule_short_en: If = possible; when = expected. Both use present.
rules.rule_short_uk: If = можливе; when = очікуване. Обидва з present.
examples: If I see Maya, I’ll tell her.
When I see Maya, I’ll tell her.
If you don’t hurry, you’ll miss the bus.

rules.rule_text_en: Use can to talk about ability, permission, or possibility in the present. The negative is can’t / cannot.
rules.rule_text_uk: Can вживають для здібності, дозволу або можливості в теперішньому. Заперечення — can’t / cannot.
rules.rule_short_en: Can = ability/permission/possibility now.
rules.rule_short_uk: Can = здатність/дозвіл/можливість зараз.
examples: I can swim, but I can’t dive.
You can park here after 6.
We can see the mountains from the window.

rules.rule_text_en: (Be) able to is similar to can, but it is needed when we use other forms (infinitive, future, perfect): I’ve been able to…, I’ll be able to…
rules.rule_text_uk: (Be) able to схоже на can, але потрібне в інших формах (інфінітив, майбутній, перфект): I’ve been able to…, I’ll be able to…
rules.rule_short_en: Able to replaces can in other tenses/forms.
rules.rule_short_uk: Able to замінює can в інших часах/формах.
examples: I’ll be able to help you tomorrow.
Have you ever been able to cook well?
I haven’t been able to sleep lately.

rules.rule_text_en: Could is often the past of can. We use could especially with verbs like see, hear, feel, remember, understand.
rules.rule_text_uk: Could часто є минулим часом від can. Особливо could вживають з дієсловами see, hear, feel, remember, understand.
rules.rule_short_en: Could = past of can (often with senses).
rules.rule_short_uk: Could = минулий від can (часто з відчуттями).
examples: It was dark, but I could see the sign.
I could hear music from next door.
When I was a child, I could run fast.

rules.rule_text_en: Use could for general ability in the past. For a specific successful action in one situation, we usually say was/were able to or managed to (not could).
rules.rule_text_uk: Could — для загальної здібності в минулому. Для конкретної успішної дії в певній ситуації зазвичай кажемо was/were able to або managed to (не could).
rules.rule_short_en: Past success in one situation: was able to / managed to.
rules.rule_short_uk: Успіх у конкретній ситуації: was able to / managed to.
examples: We were able to find a hotel in the end.
I managed to open the door.
When I was young, I could skate. (general)

rules.rule_text_en: Could can be the past of can, but it is also used for possible actions now or in the future (suggestions). It is less certain than can.
rules.rule_text_uk: Could може бути минулим від can, але також вживається для можливих дій зараз або в майбутньому (пропозиції). Це менш упевнено, ніж can.
rules.rule_short_en: Could = suggestion/possibility (less sure than can).
rules.rule_short_uk: Could = пропозиція/можливість (менш упевнено, ніж can).
examples: We could go for a walk later.
You could ask Nina about it.
It could rain this evening.

rules.rule_text_en: We use could (not can) for unreal or imagined situations: I could sleep all day (but I won’t).
rules.rule_text_uk: Could (не can) вживають для нереальних або уявних ситуацій: I could sleep all day (але не буду).
rules.rule_short_en: Could for unreal/imagined situations.
rules.rule_short_uk: Could для нереальних/уявних ситуацій.
examples: I’m so tired I could fall asleep anywhere.
I could live here forever.
That dress is lovely; it could be expensive.

rules.rule_text_en: Use could to say something is possible now or later. Compare: can change (general) vs could change (possible in this situation).
rules.rule_text_uk: Could вживають, щоб сказати, що щось можливе зараз або пізніше. Порівняй: can change (загалом) vs could change (у цій ситуації).
rules.rule_short_en: Could = possible in this situation.
rules.rule_short_uk: Could = можливо в цій ситуації.
examples: The plan could change if the weather gets worse.
Be careful; the floor could be slippery.
Traffic could be heavy at this time.

rules.rule_text_en: Could have (done) means it was possible in the past, but it did not happen.
rules.rule_text_uk: Could have (done) означає: у минулому це було можливим, але не сталося.
rules.rule_short_en: Could have done = possible but didn’t happen.
rules.rule_short_uk: Could have done = могло статися, але не сталося.
examples: I could have called you, but I forgot.
They could have won the match.
You could have hurt yourself.

rules.rule_text_en: Couldn’t do = it isn’t/wasn’t possible. Couldn’t have (done) = it was impossible in the past (it could not have happened).
rules.rule_text_uk: Couldn’t do = неможливо (зараз/тоді). Couldn’t have (done) = у минулому це було неможливо (не могло статися).
rules.rule_short_en: Couldn’t = impossible; couldn’t have = impossible in the past.
rules.rule_short_uk: Couldn’t = неможливо; couldn’t have = неможливо в минулому.
examples: I couldn’t lift the box.
It couldn’t have been him; he was abroad.
The holiday couldn’t have been better.

rules.rule_text_en: Use must to say you are sure something is true (a strong deduction). Use can’t to say you are sure something is impossible.
rules.rule_text_uk: Must вживають, коли ти впевнений, що це правда (сильний висновок). Can’t — коли впевнений, що це неможливо.
rules.rule_short_en: Must = certain; can’t = impossible.
rules.rule_short_uk: Must = точно; can’t = неможливо.
examples: You’ve worked all day. You must be exhausted.
They can’t be at home; the lights are off.
He must know the answer.

rules.rule_text_en: For the past, use must have / can’t have: She must have forgotten. He can’t have seen us. (Couldn’t have is also possible.)
rules.rule_text_uk: Для минулого вживають must have / can’t have: She must have forgotten. He can’t have seen us. (Також можливе couldn’t have.)
rules.rule_short_en: Past deduction: must have / can’t have.
rules.rule_short_uk: Висновок про минуле: must have / can’t have.
examples: The door was locked. They must have left.
He can’t have said that. It’s not like him.
I must have dropped my keys somewhere.

rules.rule_text_en: Use may or might to say something is possible (now). Negatives: may not / might not. Note: may be (two words) vs maybe (one word).
rules.rule_text_uk: May або might вживають, щоб сказати, що щось можливе (зараз). Заперечення: may not / might not. Різниця: may be (два слова) і maybe (одне слово).
rules.rule_short_en: May/might = possible; may be ≠ maybe.
rules.rule_short_uk: May/might = можливо; may be ≠ maybe.
examples: She may be in her office.
It might not be true.
Maybe we should leave now.

rules.rule_text_en: For the past, use may have / might have (and may not / might not have) to say something was possible.
rules.rule_text_uk: Для минулого вживай may have / might have (і may not / might not have), щоб сказати, що щось було можливим.
rules.rule_short_en: Past possibility: may/might have.
rules.rule_short_uk: Можливість у минулому: may/might have.
examples: She might have missed the bus.
He may not have heard you.
I may have left my phone at work.

rules.rule_text_en: Could is similar to may/might in positive sentences (It could be true). But couldn’t means ‘impossible’, not ‘perhaps not’.
rules.rule_text_uk: Could схоже на may/might у ствердженнях (It could be true). Але couldn’t означає «неможливо», а не «можливо ні».
rules.rule_short_en: Could = possible; couldn’t = impossible.
rules.rule_short_uk: Could = можливо; couldn’t = неможливо.
examples: It could be my mistake.
He couldn’t be 15 — he’s at least 20.
They might not know.

rules.rule_text_en: Use may/might to talk about possible future actions or situations. Negatives: may not / might not (mightn’t).
rules.rule_text_uk: May/might вживають для можливих дій або ситуацій у майбутньому. Заперечення: may not / might not (mightn’t).
rules.rule_short_en: May/might = possible future.
rules.rule_short_uk: May/might = можливе майбутнє.
examples: I may go out later.
It might rain this afternoon.
We might have to wait a bit.

rules.rule_text_en: We use might (not may) when the situation is unreal or imaginary, often with if: If I had more time, I might learn Italian.
rules.rule_text_uk: Might (не may) вживають, коли ситуація нереальна/уявна, часто з if: If I had more time, I might learn Italian.
rules.rule_short_en: Unreal if → might (not may).
rules.rule_short_uk: Нереальний if → might (не may).
examples: If I were taller, I might play basketball.
If they paid more, I might stay.
If I knew his number, I might call him.

rules.rule_text_en: Use may/might be -ing to talk about possible future plans or what someone could be doing at a future time. Compare with will be -ing (more certain).
rules.rule_text_uk: May/might be -ing вживають для можливих планів або того, що хтось може робити в певний момент у майбутньому. Порівняй з will be -ing (більш певно).
rules.rule_short_en: May/might be -ing = possible activity at a future time.
rules.rule_short_uk: May/might be -ing = можлива дія в майбутній момент.
examples: Don’t call at 9; I might be studying.
She may be meeting a client tomorrow morning.
We’ll be travelling next week.

rules.rule_text_en: Might as well means ‘do it because there is no better alternative’. It can also be may as well.
rules.rule_text_uk: Might as well означає «краще вже зробити, бо немає кращого варіанту». Також можливе may as well.
rules.rule_short_en: Might as well = no better alternative.
rules.rule_short_uk: Might as well = немає кращого варіанту.
examples: It’s already late, so we might as well stay here.
The shop is open, so I may as well go in.
We’ve missed the bus — we might as well walk.
